moves.2. c4 c5: If I go d5 he can play the Benko Gambit, I fear it!
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4: Sort of Sicilian type setup, huh?
moves.5. Nc2: Best place; if Nf3 d6 and he would have tempo on me. But when I go Nc2, I can focus on the queenside.
moves.5... Nc6 6. Nc3: Aiming for the hole on d5.
moves.7. e3: Stopping the threat of the Bc5 - f2.
moves.8... O-O 9. O-O: I say it's about equal. You?
moves.9... Bf5 10. Bd3: ?! Moving my bishop twice. Not a good idea.
moves.10... Qd7 11. Rb1: Planning to advance on the queenside by b4.
moves.12... Bb6 13. Qe2 Rac8: A invisible attack on my c4-pawn.
moves.15... f5: Attacking in the centre and on the kingside.
moves.16. f3: Guarding against the threat of e4.
moves.16... a5 17. b5 Ne7: He got a nice place to put his knight: c5.
moves.18. Na3 d5 19. cxd5 Nxd5 20. Nxd5 Bxd5 2: Alot of piece's exchanged. I believe I'm better. You?
moves.21... Bc5: I win a pawn no matter what: If Bc7, b6 and win the a5 or e5 pawn.
moves.23... Kh8 24. Bb2 Nf6 25. Kh1: I don't know what to do. My bad!
moves.25... Rfe8 26. Rdc1 Bd6 27. h3: So, I play positionally right now.
moves.27... Nd7 28. Nxd7 Qxd7: We each have 2 strong bishops: Mine: B2 His: D5.
moves.33... Ba3 34. Ra1 Bd6 35. Qc2 Be4 36. Bx: I exchange my weakest bishop for his strongest.
moves.43. Rc2 gxf4 44. gxf4 Bxf4: ! If exf4? Rxf4+! then taking my d4 bishop and he has won a extra pawn!
moves.45. Rc5+ Ke6 46. b6 Be5 47. Bxe5: ? Best was Rxa5 Bxd4 exd4 Rxd4 Ra7 and I have an edge.
I'm up a pawn. But if he plays it right, he should draw.
moves.57. Ra3+ Ke4 58. Ra4+: And we agreed to a draw. Hoped that you liked it? Please comment and rate it.
